intro: Barbylus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican barbylus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Jamaica. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
